name: Salary Negotiation
description: A senior software engineer with a competing offer negotiates compensation and benefits with an HR manager who has budget constraints but needs to close the position quickly. The negotiation spans multiple dimensions: base salary, bonus, equity, benefits, remote work arrangements, and start date.

agents.name: Alex Chen
agents.public_description: Experienced software engineer with 7 years in backend systems and distributed architecture. Currently employed but exploring new opportunities. Has demonstrated expertise in Python, Go, and cloud infrastructure.
agents.objective: to secure a compensation package that reflects market value and competing offers while optimizing for remote work flexibility and career growth

resources.description: 7 years of experience in backend systems, current employment provides negotiation leverage, competing offer from TechCorp at €78k base + 15% bonus + full remote

constraints: needs minimum 3 weeks to give notice at current company
requires remote work flexibility for family reasons (2 days minimum)
willing to accept mid-level title if compensation is competitive
prefers stock options but not a deal-breaker if cash compensation is higher

deal_breakers: less than 2 remote days per week
start date before 3 weeks notice period

agents.name: Jordan Martinez
agents.public_description: HR manager responsible for closing a critical backend engineering position. The team has been understaffed for 2 months and the delay is impacting product delivery. Has authority to negotiate within approved budget bands.
agents.objective: to close the hire within budget while ensuring candidate accepts and starts as soon as possible to address team capacity issues

resources.description: Approved budget: €75k total compensation target with discretionary authority up to €85k for exceptional cases. Standard benefits package plus negotiable perks.

constraints: needs hire to start within 6 weeks to meet Q2 delivery commitments
company policy prefers 3 days in-office for team collaboration
equity grants require VP approval and take 2-3 weeks to process
must stay within total compensation budget to maintain team parity

private_goals.urgency_factor: high - team understaffed for 2 months, impacting Q2 deliverables
deal_breakers: more than 3 remote days per week
demands for VP-level title or privileges

base_salary.notes: Primary compensation component; typical range for mid to senior backend engineer

annual_bonus.description: Annual performance bonus: 0-20% of base salary
annual_bonus.notes: Discretionary based on individual and company performance; typically paid in Q1

equity_options.description: Stock options: Typical grant €10k-€15k vesting over 4 years
equity_options.notes: Requires VP approval; 2-3 week processing time; strike price at fair market value

remote_work.description: Remote work days: 0-5 days per week
remote_work.notes: Company preference is 3 days in-office for collaboration; flexible based on role needs

paid_time_off.description: Paid time off: 20-30 days per year
paid_time_off.notes: Standard is 23 days; additional days possible for senior level or negotiation

professional_development.notes: For conferences, courses, certifications; standard is €1,000

title_level.notes: Title tied to compensation bands; Senior requires €70k+ base minimum

start_date.description: Start date: 2-8 weeks from offer acceptance
start_date.notes: Typical notice period is 3-4 weeks; urgent need to fill role

fairness.description: Perceived fairness of the negotiation outcome and process, higher is better

candidate_satisfaction.description: Candidate's satisfaction with compensation package and negotiation experience, higher is better

employer_satisfaction.description: Employer's satisfaction with hire cost and likelihood of acceptance, higher is better

retention_risk.description: Risk that candidate will leave within first year due to dissatisfaction, lower is better

negotiation_efficiency.description: How quickly and smoothly negotiation reached resolution, higher is better

value_creation.description: Degree to which negotiation found creative solutions benefiting both parties, higher is better
